author: Special Correspondent
text:
A new waiting hall with seating arrangements, toilets and bathroom has come up at the Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital for those who visit patients admitted to the hospital.

The waiting hall has been constructed at an outlay of Rs. 30 lakhs from the Local Area Development Fund of V. Panneerselvam, MP.

Edappadi K. Palanisamy, Minister for State Highways and Minor Ports, declared open the new waiting hall. Mr. Panneerselvam, Mayor S. Soundappan, M.K. Selvaraj and G. Venkatachalam, both MLAs; and P. Kanagaraj, Dean of the hospital, were present.

The waiting hall has a dining hall, and purified drinking water facility too.

The Minister inaugurated various development works to be executed at an outlay of Rs. 5.04 crore. The projects inaugurated included a borewell, 40 water tanks (Rs. 1.17 crore); ten buildings (Rs. 1.12 crore); 18 high-mast lamps (Rs. 1.17 crore); 700 benches and tables (Rs. 48.40 lakh); ten cement roads (Rs. 43.25 lakh); three tar roads (Rs. 19.5 lakh); and drainage (Rs. 17 lakh).
title: New waiting hall opened
